newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian MinFins firm on Western demand, US bonds.
newsitem.headline: Russian MinFins firm on Western demand, US bonds.

text.p: Prices of Russian MinFin bonds firmed in lively trading on Monday mainly on Western demand and higher prices of U.S. Treasuries, dealers said.
"The market is firmer with continuing strength in U.S. Treasuries. MinFin spreads are looking attractive," a Moscow Narodny Bank dealer said.
MinFins, along with other emerging debt, are sensitive to any news which would suggest a change in U.S. interest rates and consequently affect U.S. Treasury bond prices.
A Russian bank dealer said mostly Western operators were seen buying, while local players seemed to have no single strategy.
